CreateBatch.name: CreateBatch

requests.description: JSON-encoding of multiple request objects as described in the parameter notes

CreateBatch.summary: Performs multiple API requests in batch, useful for reducing HTTP network requests. This method is only available for OAuth authentication
CreateBatch.notes:
You may supply a limited number of API requests, typically 1 to 4, in one batch request using the required "requests" parameter. Each of these individual batched requests will be tallied separately the same way they would when making individual requests. The batch request itself will not be tallied. As such, batch requests can not be rate limited. The only failures that you should account for are an authentication failure or a malformed JSON encoding of requests provided with the "requests" parameter. #### Composing batch requests Requests should be provided within a JSON-encoded array in the following format attached the `requests` parameter within a POST body 
 [{
   "path": "/2/member/self",
   "ref":  "me",
   "params": {
     "only": "name,id"
   }
 }]
Only "path" is required for HTTP GET requests. "path" represents the API path for the method. "ref" provides a way to tag a request in a batch with a label that you can associated with its response in the body of the batch response. This will default to the provided "path". You may also supply a "params" key with a JSON object representing the parameters provided for the request. At this time only HTTP GET, DELETE, and POST requests are supported. You may specify one of these as a "method" property of the request. Methods requiring a multipart form POST are currently not supported. You may also supply headers on a per request basis by adding a "headers" field to the JSON object representing the request as key value pairs of strings. #### Interpreting batch responses A response to a batch request will be in the format 
 [{
   "path": "/2/member/self"
   "status": 200,
   "ref": "me",
   "body": {
     "id": 1234,
     "name": "Noah"
   },
   "headers": {
     "key": "value"
    }
 }]
"path" is the path of the method invoked. "status" represents the HTTP status code returned for the request. "ref" is the name provided for the inbound request. "body" is the JSON-encoded response from the given API request. "headers" is a JSON-encoded object representing the headers returned for that request. These requests may fail the same way they would when making individual requests. The response will indicate these failures. In order to preserve server resources and return batch responses within a reasonable amount of time, individual requests may timeout if a response is not computed within a reasonable amount of time. This allows for some requests to fail and others to pass which is a nicer alternative to an all or nothing response timeout. A timed out request can be identified by inspecting its response's "status" field for a value of 504. A timed out response may look like. 
 [{
   "status" : 504,
   "body" : {
    "errors" : [{"code": "request_timeout", "message":"request timed out"}]
   },
   "headers" : { ... },
   "path" : "/end/point",
   "ref" : "request_ref"
 }]

CreateGroupAbuseReports.name: CreateGroupAbuseReports

type.description: A required identifier for type of abuse you are reporting. Acceptable values include dangerous, graphic_content, graphic_photo, licensed_services, not_accurate, not_irl, other, sex, transactional

CreateGroupAbuseReports.summary: Submits a new abuse report for a target group. Abuse reports will be followed up on by our Community Support team.
CreateGroupAbuseReports.notes: This method requires the oauth `reporting` scope for oauth-authenticated requests

CreateGroupEvents.name: CreateGroupEvents

rsvp_limit.description: Total number of RSVPs slots available for the event

rsvp_open_time.description:
Sets the time when members can starting RSVPing to the event.
The time should be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.
To remove this RSVP restriction, set this parameter to 0

question.description:
Sets or edits the RSVP survey question for the event.
A maximum of 250 characters is permitted

venue_visibility.description: Controls the visibility of the event venue for non members of the hosting group. May be one of "public" or "members"

description.description: Description of the event, in simple HTML format. This value is translated to HTML to update the description. May not be longer than 50000 characters.

rsvp_close_time.description:
Sets the time when members can no longer RSVP to the event.
The time should be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.
To remove this RSVP restriction, set this parameter to 0

lon.description: Adjusted venue longitude. Must be accompanied by 'lat' request parameter.

how_to_find_us.description: The information provided by the event host for "How will members find you there?". Visible when location is visible to the authenticated member

announce.description: Boolean value indicating whether or not Meetup should announce this event to interested group members

duration.description:
Event duration in milliseconds. When not specified, a default of 3 hours from the event `time` may be assumed by applications.
To clear event duration, set this to 0

event_hosts.description: Up to 5 comma-separated valid member ids to be hosts for the event.

name.description: Display name of the event. May not be longer than 80 characters

guest_limit.description: Number of guests members may include in their RSVP, 0 or more. This defaults to 2 when undefined.

self_rsvp.description: The authenticated member will be RSVP'd to the created event. If `event_hosts` is not provided or is empty, the authenticated member will also be the event host. Defaults to "true".

time.description:
Event start time in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.

Scheduling Meetup events without a time will result in events in "proposed" status

publish_status.description: If you are an organizer of the group, you may set this to "draft" to save the event as a draft. Doing so will require a status=draft filter on /2/event queries

lat.description: Adjusted venue latitude. Must be accompanied by a 'lon' request parameter.

CreateGroupEvents.summary: Creates a new Meetup group event
CreateGroupEvents.notes:
A valid path parameter for __:urlname__ is required.

Only members of the lead team may post new Meetup events

Creating an event without a `time` will result in an event with a "proposed"
status.

Event descriptions only support a subset of HTML, `B`, `I`, `A` in particular. Response bodies will include a description field that
returns a full HTML rendering of the provided description. Links to images will be rendered in `IMG` tags, but when editing, you should omit the `IMG` tag markup.
To get back the simplified markup, append 'simple_html_description' to the 'fields' request parameter.

OAuth authenticated applications should request the [event_management](/meetup_api/auth/#event_management_scope) OAuth scope.

CreateGroupEventsComments.name: CreateGroupEventsComments

comment.description: The text of the comment in at most 1024 characters

notifications.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not you wish to recieve future notifications about updates to this comment thread

in_reply_to.description: If posting a reply, set this to the numeric identifier of the associated top level comment

CreateGroupEventsComments.summary: Creates new comments and replies to existing comments within an Meetup event
CreateGroupEventsComments.notes:
A path parameter for __:urlname__, __:event_id__,
and __:comment_id__ is required.

In addition,
authorized oauth applications should request the
[group_content_edit](/meetup_api/auth/#group_content_edit_scope) permission scope.

CreateGroupEventsPhotos.name: CreateGroupEventsPhotos

await.description: Optional boolean parameter that will defer a request's a response until confirmation that photo is immediately displayable is received.

fields.description:
A comma-delimited list of optional response fields.
Currently supported values are "self" and "comment_count"

photo.description: Photo upload data, encoded as multipart/form-data. The maximum file size allowed is 10MB

CreateGroupEventsPhotos.summary: Support for uploading new Event photos
CreateGroupEventsPhotos.notes:
A valid path parameter value for
__:urlname__ and __:event_id__
is required

This method expects an HTTP POST containing a Content-Type of `multipart/form-data`.
Only the `photo` parameter, which represents the photo being uploaded, is required.

Uploaded photos are fed into a separate photo cropping process and may not be
immediately available for display. To receive responses for photos that are immediately
displayable, send the `await` request parameter with a value of `true`.

A maximum of 500 photos are allowed for a given event.

Authentication credentials should be omitted from the request body and be sent via
HTTP Authorization header or as query string parameters

CreateGroupEventsRsvps.name: CreateGroupEventsRsvps

guests.description:
The number of guests Member will be attending with.
Events may define guest limits which is 2 by default

response.description: The authenticated Member's RSVP response. Supported values are either "yes" or "no"

opt_to_pay.description: A boolean indicator used for Events with ticketing fees to imply the Member has opted to pay as part of the RSVP request

answer_{qid}.description:
Answers to Event survey questions.
Parameter names should have a suffix specifying the question's identifier.
Answers may not be longer than 250 characters.

agree_to_refund.description: A boolean indicator used for Events with ticketing feeds to imply the Member has agreed to the Event's refund policy

CreateGroupEventsRsvps.summary: Creates or updates an existing RSVP
CreateGroupEventsRsvps.notes:
The RSVP with be attributed to the currently authenticated member.

Organizers may define a set of survey questions they intend members to answer when
RSVPing. Members RSVPing may provide answers to those questions
by supplying parameter names that correspond with question identifiers.
To resolve any defined survey questions, you can inspect the
[Event Get](/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/events/:id/#get)'s
response body for the 'survey_questions' field

If the Event requires payment, you are required to send an
'agree_to_refund' parameter set to true. This represents
the authenticated Member's agreement to understanding the
Event's refund policy.

Note: When space is not available, "yes" responses may be coerced into a
waitlist response. This indicates that the authenticated member
has expressed interest in attending when space becomes available.

OAuth authenticated applications should
request the [rsvp](/meetup_api/auth/#rsvp_scope)
permission scope

CreateGroupMemberApprovals.name: CreateGroupMemberApprovals

member.description: Comma-delimited numeric pending member IDs. The maximum allowed is 200

welcome_message.description: Optional message to send to the members being approved. If not provided, the groups default welcome message will be sent. Max message size is 2000

send_copy.description: Optional boolean value indicating whether or not the org should receive a copy of the message sent to the approved members

CreateGroupMemberApprovals.summary: Approves one or more requests for group membership
CreateGroupMemberApprovals.notes: The :urlname path element may be any valid group urlname or domain name. If you need access to your group's welcome message, you can access it from the [/2/groups](/meetup_api/docs/2/groups/#response) method, providing a value of `welcome_message` for the fields parameter. To get a list of pending members, as an organizer, you can request the status `pending` in the [/2/profiles](/meetup_api/docs/2/profiles/#params) method.

CreateGroupMembers.name: CreateGroupMembers
CreateGroupMembers.summary: This method allows an authenticated member to join a group by creating a profile
CreateGroupMembers.notes:
This method requires https and an HTTP POST. All required parameters must be supplied.
An intro and answers to group profile questions may be required based for the group the member is joining.

OAuth authenticated applications should
request the [group_join](/meetup_api/auth/#group_join_scope)
permission scope

To find out if a group requires an intro or answers to questions, query for the group
through one of the groups methods providing setting the fields parameter to join_info and
inspecting the join_info in the results.
Answers to the questions must be named using the convention answer_{question_id}.

CreateGroupPhotoAlbumsPhotos.name: CreateGroupPhotoAlbumsPhotos

await.description: Optional boolean parameter that will defer a request's a response until confirmation that photo is immediately displayable is received.

fields.description:
A comma-delimited list of optional response fields.
Currently supported values are "self" and "comment_count"

photo.description: Photo upload data, encoded as multipart/form-data. The maximum file size allowed is 10MB

CreateGroupPhotoAlbumsPhotos.summary: Support for uploading new Album photos
CreateGroupPhotoAlbumsPhotos.notes:
A valid path parameter value for
__:urlname__ and __:album_id__
is required

This method expects an HTTP POST containing a Content-Type of `multipart/form-data`.
Only the `photo` parameter, which represents the photo being uploaded, is required.

Uploaded photos are fed into a separate photo cropping process and may not be
immediately available for display. To receive responses for photos that are immediately
displayable, send the `await` request parameter with a value of `true`.

A maximum of 500 photos are allowed for a given album.

Authentication credentials should be omitted from the request body and be sent via
HTTP Authorization header or as query string parameters

CreateGroupTopics.name: CreateGroupTopics

topic_id.description: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to associate with group

CreateGroupTopics.summary: Associates topics with a given Meetup group. Limited to organizers of the group. OAuth authenticated requests require an additional [group_edit](/meetup_api/auth/#oauth2-scopes) permission.
CreateGroupTopics.notes: A group can have at most 15 topics

CreateGroupVenues.name: CreateGroupVenues

state.description: If in the US or CA, the state code for the venue

hours.description: Open hours information about the venue

country.description: 2 character country code of the venue

web_url.description: Optional web url for the venue

visibility.description: Optional value indicating the venues visibility to others. May be one of private or public. Defaults to 'public'

phone.description: Optional phone number for the venue

CreateGroupVenues.summary: Interface for creating new Meetup venues
CreateGroupVenues.notes: The :urlname path element may be any valid group urlname or domain name. The required parameters are highlighted below. To avoid creating duplicate Meetup venues, this endpoint will attempt to resolve potentially similar venues based on name and address before creating a new public venues. If potential matches are detected, this method will return a 409 Conflict response containing a list of potential matches

fields.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.

since_id.description: The id of the newest notification item, typically the first in the list returned by the notifications endpoint

CreateRecommendedGroupsIgnores.name: CreateRecommendedGroupsIgnores
CreateRecommendedGroupsIgnores.summary: Provides a form of feedback by requesting to remove a group from future recommendations
CreateRecommendedGroupsIgnores.notes: Only the path parameter :urlname is required. You are limited to 100 of these requests in a 24 hour period of time.

CreateSelfAbuseReports.name: CreateSelfAbuseReports

member_id.description: A numeric identifier for the member being reported. If not provided, this will be infered by the author of the content associated with the provided `content_tag`

type.description: A required identifier for type of abuse you are reporting. Acceptable values include abuse, cron, dangerous, dislike_photo, fake, graphic_content, graphic_photo, impersonation, inappropriate, inappropriate_photo, join, licensed_services, not_accurate, not_irl, offsite, other, photo, sex, spam, transactional, underage

comments.description: An optional string of text that describes why you are submitting this report

url.description: An optional URL for the location of the reported content if one exists

content_tag.description: An optional identifier for flagged content that identifies both the type and id, where possible, of the content reported. The type and id should be separated by a ':' character, e.g `event_comment:{event_comment_id}`. Valid content_tag types include conversation, conversation_message, convo, email, event_comment, event_photo, group, mailing_list, member_photo, member_profile, message_board, organizer_broadcast, pro_megaphone, reply. If member_id is not provided, content_tag should be provided to imply member_id

CreateSelfAbuseReports.summary: Submits a new abuse report for a target member. Abuse reports will be followed up on by our Community Support team.
CreateSelfAbuseReports.notes: This method requires the oauth `reporting` scope for oauth-authenticated requests

CreateSelfBlocks.name: CreateSelfBlocks

report.description: An optional value that represents a type of abuse the target member is being blocked for. Acceptable values include one of the following: fake, impersonation, inappropriate_photo, offsite, underage

comments.description: An optional string of text describing why you have chosen to block this member

CreateSelfBlocks.summary: Blocks a target member from various interactions with the authenticated member on the platform
CreateSelfBlocks.notes: A valid member_id path parameter for the target member is required. This method requires the oauth `reporting` scope for oauth-authenticated requests

DeleteGroupEvents.name: DeleteGroupEvents
DeleteGroupEvents.summary: Removes an event from a groups calendar
DeleteGroupEvents.notes:
Valid path parameters for __:urlname__ and event __:id__ are required.

Only organizers and the poster of the Meetup event may delete the event

OAuth authenticated applications should request the [event_management](/meetup_api/auth/#event_management_scope) OAuth scope.

DeleteGroupEventsComments.name: DeleteGroupEventsComments
DeleteGroupEventsComments.notes:
A path parameter for __:urlname__, __:event_id__,
and __:comment_id__ is required.

The __:comment_id__ path parameter should be formatted as `comment:{comment_id}`
for top level comments or `reply:{reply_id}` for comment replies

To obtain a list of comments and their replies for an event, see the
[event comments](/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/events/:event_id/comments/) endpoint

Only organizers or the member that posted the comment may delete the comment

In addition,
authorized oauth applications should request the
[group_content_edit](/meetup_api/auth/#group_content_edit_scope) permission scope.

DeleteGroupEventsPhotosComments.name: DeleteGroupEventsPhotosComments
DeleteGroupEventsPhotosComments.notes:
A URI containing a valid group __urlname__,
__event_id__, __photo_id__, and __comment_id__
is required.

The authenticated member must
be the original poster of the comment.

In addition,
authorized oauth applications should request the
[group_content_edit](/meetup_api/auth/#group_content_edit_scope) permission scope.

DeleteGroupEventsWatchlist.name: DeleteGroupEventsWatchlist
DeleteGroupEventsWatchlist.summary: Remove yourself from an event watchlist
DeleteGroupEventsWatchlist.notes: No parameters are required. You should only call this method if you request the fields parameter 'self' in any events methods and get back a self.actions field containing 'unwatch'

DeleteGroupMemberApprovals.name: DeleteGroupMemberApprovals

member.description: Comma-delimited numeric pending member IDs. The maximum allowed is 200

anon.description: Optional Boolean value indicating whether the declining member's email address should be hidden in the resulting response. Default is true.

send_copy.description: Optional Boolean value indicating whether or not to send a copy to the member issuing the decline. Default is false

explanation.description: Optional explanation to send to the members being declined. Max message size is 2000

ban.description: Optional Boolean value indicating whether or not to ban the member in the future. Default is false

DeleteGroupMemberApprovals.summary: Declines one or more requests for group membership
DeleteGroupMemberApprovals.notes: The :urlname path element may be any valid group urlname or domain name. To get a list of pending members, as an organizer, you can request the status `pending` in the [/2/profiles](/meetup_api/docs/2/profiles/#params) method.

DeleteGroupMembers.name: DeleteGroupMembers

exit_comment.description: Optional message to the organizer when leaving

DeleteGroupMembers.notes:
A valid path parameter for :urlname and :member_id is required. A value of "self"
may be used in place of a numeric identifier to represent the authenticated
Member's id.

OAuth authenticated applications should
request the [profile_edit](/meetup_api/auth/#profile_edit_scope)
permission scope

Only the authenticated member is permitted to leave groups they do not organize. For groups they do organize,
they must first step down on the groups homepage on www.meetup.com

DeleteGroupTopics.name: DeleteGroupTopics

topic_id.description: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to disassociate with group

DeleteGroupTopics.summary: Disassociates topics with a given Meetup group. Limited to organizers of the group. OAuth authenticated requests require an additional [group_edit](/meetup_api/auth/#oauth2-scopes) permission.
DeleteGroupTopics.notes: Groups must have at least one topic. Attempts to remove all topics will result in a failed request

DeleteSelfBlocks.name: DeleteSelfBlocks
DeleteSelfBlocks.summary: Unblocks a previously blocked member from various interactions with the authenticated member on the platform
DeleteSelfBlocks.notes: A valid member_id path parameter for the target member is required. This method requires the oauth `reporting` scope for oauth-authenticated requests.

EditGroup.name: EditGroup

urlname.description: Name used for the groups web address on meetup.com. Must be between 6 and 60 characters

zip.description: The ZIP code of the city

country.description: The ISO_3166-1 country code for the country which contains the city

list_mode.description: Defines policy for who can post to the group mailing list. May be one of 'open' meaning any member can post, 'off' meaning no one can post, 'moderated' meaning messages must be approved, or 'orgs_only' meaning only organizers may post to the list

dryrun.description: Boolean parameter that will cause this endpoint to apply all validation rules without actually saving changes in which case the response will only reflect the group's current attributes

remove_topics.description: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to disassociate with group

visibility.description: Restricts group visibility for non-members. May be one of 'public', 'public_limited' or 'members'. Note, the 'members' option is only available to groups that already have 'members' visibility

question_{index}.description: A new profile question defined in the order of index provided in the request parameter name

key_photo.description: Group's primary photo. Must be ID of an existing album photo

photo_req.description: Indicates that a member must provide a photo before joining. Expects true or false values

description.description: Summary of what the Meetup group is about in simple HTML format

questions_req.description: Indicates that provided questions are required before joining. Expects true or false values

welcome_message.description: Message sent to members after they join. Can be at most 2000 characters

join_mode.description: Controls how member's are let into the group. May be one of 'open' meaning any Meetup member my join, 'closed' meaning group is not currently accepting new members, or 'approval' meaning members must be approved by an organizer. Note, the 'closed' options is only available to groups that already have a 'closed' join_mode

list_addr.description: Mailing list prefix. By default this is the group's urlname.

add_topics.description: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to associate with group

{service}_uri.description: A URI for a social network service. Service must be one of facebook, flickr, linkedin, other, tumblr, twitter

name.description: Display name of the group. Can be at most 60 characters

question_edit_{id}.description: Edits a current profile question identified by an id in the parameter name. The index updated index should also be encoded in the parameter name. To delete a question, set this to an empty string. Groups that require profile questions must have at least one question

who.description: What members of the group will be called. Can be at most 32 characters

EditGroup.summary: Allows organizers to edit their Meetup group information. To change group topics, see the [add](/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/topics/#add) and [remove](/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/topics/#remove) topics endpoints. To change group photo use the [Group photo upload](/meetup_api/docs/2/group_photo/#create) endpoint. OAuth authenticated requests require an additional [group_edit](/meetup_api/auth/#oauth2-scopes) permission.

EditGroupEvents.name: EditGroupEvents

rsvp_limit.description: Total number of RSVPs slots available for the event

rsvp_open_time.description:
Sets the time when members can starting RSVPing to the event.
The time should be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.
To remove this RSVP restriction, set this parameter to 0

question.description:
Sets or edits the RSVP survey question for the event.
A maximum of 250 characters is permitted

venue_visibility.description: Controls the visibility of the event venue for non members of the hosting group. May be one of "public" or "members"

description.description: Description of the event, in simple HTML format. This value is translated to HTML to update the description. May not be longer than 50000 characters.

rsvp_close_time.description:
Sets the time when members can no longer RSVP to the event.
The time should be specified in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.
To remove this RSVP restriction, set this parameter to 0

lon.description: Adjusted venue longitude. Must be accompanied by 'lat' request parameter.

how_to_find_us.description: The information provided by the event host for "How will members find you there?". Visible when location is visible to the authenticated member

announce.description: Boolean value indicating whether or not Meetup should announce this event to interested group members

duration.description:
Event duration in milliseconds. When not specified, a default of 3 hours from the event `time` may be assumed by applications.
To clear event duration, set this to 0

event_hosts.description: Up to 5 comma-separated valid member ids to be hosts for the event.

name.description: Display name of the event. May not be longer than 80 characters

guest_limit.description: Number of guests members may include in their RSVP, 0 or more. This defaults to 2 when undefined.

time.description:
Event start time in milliseconds since the epoch, or relative to the current time in the d/w/m format.

Scheduling Meetup events without a time will result in events in "proposed" status

publish_status.description: If you are an organizer of the group, you may set this to "draft" to save the event as a draft. Doing so will require a status=draft filter on /2/event queries

lat.description: Adjusted venue latitude. Must be accompanied by a 'lon' request parameter.

EditGroupEvents.summary: Updates an existing Meetup group event's details
EditGroupEvents.notes:
Valid path parameters for __:urlname__ and event __:id__ are required.

Event descriptions only support a subset of HTML. Please see the [Event Create](/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/events/#createparams) 
documentation for more information.

OAuth authenticated applications should request the [event_management](/meetup_api/auth/#event_management_scope) OAuth scope.

EditGroupEventsAttendance.name: EditGroupEventsAttendance

guests.description: The number of guests accompanying member. Maximum of 99 is allowed. When providing multiple values in the `member` field, this value is ignored

headcount.description: Sets the overall headcount for the event. This may not necessarily correlate with the list of attendees in this group if the event is part of a joint Meetup event. When providing multiple values in the `member` field, this value is ignored

member.description: A comma-delimited list of valid ids associated with members RSVP'd to the event

status.description: An attendance status for the provided members. Must be one of: noshow, absent, attended

EditGroupEventsAttendance.summary: Takes member attendance for an event. Limited for use by administrative members.
EditGroupEventsAttendance.notes: The :urlname path element may be any valid group urlname or domain name. The :id path element must be a valid alphanumeric Meetup event identifier. Highlighted fields are required.

EditGroupEventsPayments.name: EditGroupEventsPayments

amount.description: The monetary amount of money the member submitted

quantity.description: The number of payments made. Defaults to 1

member.description: Member Id of member who made a payment

paid_on.description: The time the payment was made in milliseconds from the epoc. Defaults to now

EditGroupEventsPayments.summary: Allows organizers of a group to note payments made by members for an event. This is the 'Mark Paid' feature seen in the RSVP listings on event details pages and affects the 'pay_status' response fields in [2/rsvps](/meetup_api/docs/2/rsvps/#response) for paid events
EditGroupEventsPayments.notes: Only organizer may submit payment information for members and only one payment may be submitted for a member for a given event

EditGroupEventsWatchlist.name: EditGroupEventsWatchlist
EditGroupEventsWatchlist.summary: Add yourself to an event watchlist to get notified when a spot becomes available
EditGroupEventsWatchlist.notes: No parameters are required. You should only call this method if you request the fields parameter 'self' in any events methods and get back a self.actions field containing 'watch'

EditGroupMembers.name: EditGroupMembers

add_role.description:
Allows those with permission to assign one of the following roles:
"assistant_organizer", "coorganizer", or "event_organizer"

photo_id.description: Numeric id of the photo to use for this profile. Send a value of 0 to unset the current photo

intro.description:
Provides a Member an opportunity to tell the group about themselves,
in at most 255 characters

fields.description:
A comma-delimited string of optional response field names.
This may include birthday, gender, groups, privacy, self and topics

title.description:
An organizer-defined title,
in at most 255 characters

remove_role.description:
Allows those with permission to remove one of the following roles:
"assistant_organizer", "coorganizer", or "event_organizer"

answer_{qid}.description:
Answers to questions from group's API join_info question fields.

The name of these parameters must contain a suffix of _ + the numeric
question id from the Meetup group's join info question list

Answers may not be longer than 1000
characters in length

EditGroupMembers.summary:
Edits Group Profiles.
To fetch Group Member Profiles,
see [this endpoint](/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/members/:member_id#get)
EditGroupMembers.notes:
A valid path parameter for :urlname and :member_id is required. A value of "self"
may be used in place of a numeric identifier to represent the authenticated
Member's id.

OAuth authenticated applications should
request the [profile_edit](/meetup_api/auth/#profile_edit_scope)
permission scope

Only organizers of the Meetup group may edit the member's __title__ and __role__ within the group.

All other fields are restricted to the owner of the group profile.

Some Meetup group organizers may define a set of profile questions
they'd like their members to answer. You can obtain that question
list using the [Get Group](/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/#get) by sending
 a "fields" request parameter containing
"join_info"

EditMembers.name: EditMembers

birthday.description:
Member's date or year of birth.
May be specified in one of the following formats.
yyyy, mmddyyy or alternatively -1, which indicates that birthday
data should be cleared

zip.description:
A valid zip code to associate with the member.
This parameter must be accompanied by "lat" and "lon"

remove_topics.description: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to remove from members interest list

photo_id.description: A valid photo id to this member has previously updated to use as profile photo

gender.description:
Member's gender.
Value may be one of "female", "male", "none", or "other"

topics_privacy.description:
Preference for hiding or showing member interests to others.
Value may be one of "hidden" or "visible"

bio.description: Member bio of up to 250 characters

facebook_privacy.description:
Preference for hiding showing information member's facebook connection.
Value may be one of "hidden" or "visible"

lon.description:
A valid longitude to resolve the closest location to associate with the member
This parameter must be accompanied by "lat" and "zip"

groups_privacy.description:
Preference for hiding or showing group memberships to others.
Value may be one of "hidden" or "visible"

add_topics.description: Comma-delimited list of topic ids to add to members interest list

sync_photo.description:
When set to true, this parameter will sync all the group
profile photos for the member with the provided photo_id

bio_privacy.description:
Preference for hiding or showing member bio to others.
Value may be one of "hidden" or "visible"

lang.description:
Member's language preference.
Value may be one of "de-DE", "en-AU", "en-US", "es", "es-ES", "fr-FR", "it-IT", "ja-JP", or "pt-BR"

lat.description:
A valid latitude to resolve the closest location to associate with the member.
This parameter must be accompanied by "lon" and "zip"

city_id.description: Valid Meetup city identifier that indicates the city in which the member resides

messaging_pref.description:
Preference for which members may contact you via the Meetup platform.
Value may be one of "all_members", "groups_only", or "orgs_only"

EditMembers.notes:
All parameters are optional.

OAuth authenticated applications should
request the [profile_edit](/meetup_api/auth/#profile_edit_scope)
permission scope

Some Meetup group organizers may define a set of profile questions
they'd like their members to answer. You can obtain that question
list using the [Get Group](/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/#get) by sending
 a "fields" request parameter containing
"join_info"

The authenticated member may set their currently location by either supplying a valid
"city_id" or a valid "lat", "lon", or "zip".
You can resolve a coordinate-based "zip" by using the
[Find locations](/meetup_api/docs/find/locations) API

GetFindGroups.name: GetFindGroups

zip.description: Zipcode of location to limit search to

country.description: A valid two character country code, defaults to US

upcoming_events.description: If true, filters text and category based searches on groups that have upcoming events. Defaults to false

filter.description: Determines which groups are returned. If 'all' (default), the text and category parameters are applied. If 'friends', groups your friends are in are returned. The value of this parameter may be one of all, friends

fallback_suggestions.description: boolean indicator of whether or not to return a list of curated suggestions for groups if we can't find groups matching your criteria

topic_id.description: Comma-delimited list of numeric topic ids

radius.description: Radius in miles. May be 0.0-100.0, 'global' or 'smart', a dynamic radius based on the number of active groups in the area. Defaults to member's preferred radius

fields.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.

category.description: Comma-delimited list of numeric category ids

self_groups.description: set to 'include' or 'exclude' Meetups the authorized member belongs to; default is 'include'

newest.description: Order by date group was founded

most_active.description: Order by group with most active members

GetFindGroups.summary: Text, location, category and friend-based group searches
GetFindGroups.notes:
All parameters are optional. If you do not supply some explicit form of location, the results will be based on your registered Meetup profile location, falling back on your IP's geographic location.

If we can't find find Meetup groups matching your criteria you may optionally request that a small set of suggestions are returned in their place.
To do so, send a request parameter named `fallback_suggestions` set to `true`. You can infer that a list of Meetup groups return are fallback suggestions when
the `X-Total-Count` pagination response header has a `0` value.

See the 'filter' parameter for more information controlling the results returned. Ordering does not apply to friend-filtered queries.

GetFindLocations.name: GetFindLocations

lon.description:
Search for locations based on location longitude.
Must be provided with "lat"

lat.description:
Search for locations based on location latitude.
Must be provided with "lon"

query.description: Search for locations based on city name or zip code

GetFindLocations.summary: Provides a query interface for finding known locations
GetFindLocations.notes: This endpoint uses HTTP [Link header based pagination](/meetup_api/docs/#v3_json).

GetFindTopicCategories.name: GetFindTopicCategories

lon.description: An optional approximate longitude to center a request for "best_topics"

fields.description: A comma-limited list of optional fields to append to the response

radius.description: An radius (in miles) to center a request for "best_topics"

lat.description: An optional approximate latitude to center a request for "best_topics"

GetFindTopicCategories.summary: Returns a list high level topic categories
GetFindTopicCategories.notes:
No parameters are required. Authenticated members may request "best_topics"
using the "fields" request parameter. By default these topics will selected
based on groups in the member's location. Alternatively you may supply a "lat",
"lon", and "radius" to center these topic suggestions

GetFindTopics.name: GetFindTopics

query.description: The text to topic text search for

GetFindTopics.notes: This endpoint uses HTTP [Link header based pagination](/meetup_api/docs/#v3_json).

GetGroup.name: GetGroup

fields.description: A comma-delimited list of optional fields to append to the response

GetGroup.summary: Fetches a Meetup group by urlname
GetGroup.notes: Only the path parameter :urlname is required

GetGroupBoards.name: GetGroupBoards
GetGroupBoards.notes: The :urlname path element may be any valid group urlname or domain name

GetGroupBoardsDiscussions.name: GetGroupBoardsDiscussions
GetGroupBoardsDiscussions.notes: The :urlname path element may be any valid group urlname or domain name. The :bid path element maybe any valid board ID for this group. The :did may be any valid discussion ID for this board

GetGroupEvents.name: GetGroupEvents

scroll.description:
A string representing a scroll target

__recent_past__: Scroll the the last past Meetup Event. If there are no recently events in the past,
this defaults to __next_upcoming__. Unless otherwise specified, this will apply a 'status' filter
of "upcoming" and "past".

__next_upcoming__: Scroll to the next upcoming Meetup event. Unless otherwise specified, this will apply a 'status'
filter of "upcoming" and "past"

fields.description: Comma-delimited list of optional fields to append to the response

status.description: A comma-delimited list of event statuses. This defaults to "upcoming" unless a scroll parameter is provided.

GetGroupEvents.summary: Gets a listing of all Meetup Events hosted by a target group
GetGroupEvents.notes:
All parameters are optional.

This endpoint uses HTTP [Link header based pagination](/meetup_api/docs/#v3_json)

GetGroupEventsAttendance.name: GetGroupEventsAttendance

filter.description: A named filter to apply to the attendance list. These are roughly equivalent to the set of filters you will see in the attendance tool on the site. These filters correspond with attendance records as well as each member's original RSVP status. The filter value be one of: maybe, waitlist, yes, absent, all, attended, noshow, excused, relevant, no. The default is 'attended'. The 'absent' filter represents all members not in attendance including members with a 'noshow' status. An 'excused' absence is an absent member marked as such by an administrative member

member.description: Raw text used to search for member by name. This may only be applied when the filter parameter is set to 'all'. The provided text must consist of at least 2 characters.

GetGroupEventsAttendance.summary: Lists attendance records for Meetup events. Limited for use by administrative members.
GetGroupEventsAttendance.notes: The :urlname path element may be any valid group urlname or domain name. The :id path element must be a valid alphanumeric Meetup event identifier

GetGroupEventsComments.name: GetGroupEventsComments

fields.description:
A comma-delimited list of optional fields to append to the response.
Currently only "self" is supported

GetGroupEventsComments.summary:
Lists the comments and replies posted in a given Meetup Event.

To view the list of likes for a comment or reply
see the [likes](/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/events/:event_id/comments/:comment_id/likes/)
endpoint
GetGroupEventsComments.notes:
A valid path parameter for __:urlname__ and __:event_id__
is required.

GetGroupEventsCommentsLikes.name: GetGroupEventsCommentsLikes
GetGroupEventsCommentsLikes.summary: Returns lists of likes for an event comment or reply
GetGroupEventsCommentsLikes.notes:
A path parameter for __:urlname__,  __:event_id__,
and __:comment_id__ is required

The __:comment_id__ should be formatted as `comment:{comment_id}` for top level comments
or `reply:{reply_id}` for comment replies.

To obtain a list of comments and their replies for an event, see the
[event comments](/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/events/:event_id/comments/) endpoint

GetGroupEventsPhotos.name: GetGroupEventsPhotos

fields.description:
A comma-delimited list of optional response fields.
Currently supported values are
"comment_count", "self" and "short_link"

GetGroupEventsPhotos.summary: Gets information about a specific photo
GetGroupEventsPhotos.notes:
A valid path parameter value for
__:urlname__ and __:event_id__, and __:photo_id__
is required

GetGroupEventsRsvps.name: GetGroupEventsRsvps

fields.description: A comma-delimited list of optional fields to append to the response

response.description:
Filter returned list to one or more of the following RSVP responses.
"yes" or "no". This defaults to "yes,no"

GetGroupEventsRsvps.notes: This endpoint returns an un-paginated list of RSVPs. Standard pagination parameters will have no effect

GetGroupMembers.name: GetGroupMembers

fields.description:
A comma-delimited string of optional response field names.
This may include birthday, gender, groups, privacy, self and topics

GetGroupMembers.summary:
Gets Group Profiles.
For Member Profiles, see [this endpoint](/meetup_api/docs/members/:member_id)
GetGroupMembers.notes:
A valid path parameter for :urlname and :member_id is required. A value of "self"
may be used in place of a numeric identifier to represent the authenticated
Member's id

GetGroupPhotoAlbums.name: GetGroupPhotoAlbums

fields.description:
A comma-delimited list of optional response fields.
Currently supported values are "self" and "short_link"

GetGroupPhotoAlbums.summary: Gets a list a group photo albums in ascending order based on the time they were created
GetGroupPhotoAlbums.notes:
A valid path parameter value for
__:urlname__ is required

This endpoint uses HTTP [Link header based pagination](/meetup_api/docs/#v3_json).

GetGroupPhotoAlbumsPhotos.name: GetGroupPhotoAlbumsPhotos

fields.description:
A comma-delimited list of optional response fields.
Currently supported values are
"comment_count", "self" and "short_link"

GetGroupPhotoAlbumsPhotos.summary: Lists photos for a given photo album
GetGroupPhotoAlbumsPhotos.notes:
A valid path parameter for
__:urlname__ and __:album_id__ is required

GetGroupPhotos.name: GetGroupPhotos

fields.description:
A comma-delimited list of optional response fields.
Currently supported values are
"comment_count", "self" and "short_link"

GetGroupPhotos.summary: Lists of all photos uploaded for the group
GetGroupPhotos.notes:
A valid path parameter for
__:urlname__ and __:album_id__ is required

This endpoint uses HTTP [Link header based pagination](/meetup_api/docs/#v3_json)

GetGroupSimilarGroups.name: GetGroupSimilarGroups
GetGroupSimilarGroups.summary: Renders a list of similar groups
GetGroupSimilarGroups.notes: The :urlname path element may be any valid group urlname or domain name.

GetGroupVenues.name: GetGroupVenues
GetGroupVenues.summary: Returns venues a group has previously hosted events at
GetGroupVenues.notes: The :urlname path element may be any valid group urlname or domain name. All parameters are optional

GetMembers.name: GetMembers

fields.description:
A comma-delimited string of optional response field names.
This may include groups, privacy, and topics

GetMembers.summary:
Gets Member Profiles.
For Group Profiles, see [this endpoint](/meetup_api/docs/:urlname/members/:member_id)
GetMembers.notes:
A valid path parameter for :member_id is required. A value of "self"
may be used in place of a numeric identifier to represent the authenticated
Member's id

GetNotifications.name: GetNotifications

fields.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.

GetNotifications.summary: Returns all recent Meetup notifications for the authorized member. To mark notifications read use [/notifications/read](/meetup_api/docs/notifications/read/) endpoint. To get the authenticated Member's current unread count, request it in an [HTTP header](/meetup_api/docs/#meta-headers).

GetProGroups.name: GetProGroups

past_rsvps_min.description: Positive Integer: Minumum range of the total number of past RSVPs

past_events_min.description: Positive Integer: Minumum range of the number of the past events held

member_count_max.description: Positive Integer: Maximum range of the number of members

upcoming_events_min.description: Positive Integer: Minumum range of the number of the upcoming events

last_event_min.description: Milliseconds since epoch: Minumum range of the date that the last meetup happened

repeat_rsvpers_min.description: Positive Integer: Minumum range of the average number of repeat rsvpers

average_age_min.description: Positive Integer: Minumum range of the average age of the members

last_event_max.description: Milliseconds since epoch: Maximum range of the date that the last meetup happened

radius.description: String: `global`, `smart`, or search radius in Float

founded_date_min.description: Milliseconds since epoch: Minumum range of the founded dates of the groups

inactive_within_days.description: Positive Integer: including only those groups that did not have event in the last specified days

topics.description: List of Integers: the ids of topic of the group

upcoming_events_max.description: Positive Integer: Maximum range of the number of the upcoming events

average_age_max.description: Positive Integer: Maximum range of the average age of the members

pro_join_date_max.description: Milliseconds since epoch: Maximum range of the dates the groups joined Pro organization

next_event_min.description: Milliseconds since epoch: Minumum range of the date that the next meetup is scheduled

past_rsvps_max.description: Positive Integer: Maximum range of the total number of past RSVPs

active_within_days.description: Positive Integer: including only those groups that had event in the last specified days

rsvps_per_event_min.description: Positive Integer: Minumum range of the average number of RSVPs per event

founded_date_max.description: Milliseconds since epoch: Maximum range of the founded dates of the groups

member_count_min.description: Positive Integer: Minimum range of the number of members

past_events_max.description: Positive Integer: Maximum range of the number of the past events held

name.description: String: Name of the group looking for

next_event_max.description: Milliseconds since epoch: Maximum range of the date that the next meetup is scheduled

repeat_rsvpers_max.description: Positive Integer: Maximum range of the average number of repeat rsvpers

pro_join_date_min.description: Milliseconds since epoch: Minumum range of the dates the groups joined Pro organization

rsvps_per_event_max.description: Positive Integer: Maximum range of the average number of RSVPs per event

category.description: List of Integers: the ids of the category of the group

repeat_rsvpers.description: By the number of members RSVPing subsequent events

gender_female.description: By the proportion of people who identify themselves as female

past_events.description: By the number of past meetups held

past_rsvps.description: By the total number of past RSVPs

gender_unknown.description: By the proportion of people whose gender info is unknown

gender_male.description: By the proportion of people who identify themselves as male

founded_date.description: By the founded date of the group

pro_join_date.description: By the date the group joined the Pro org

rsvps_per_event.description: By the average number of RSVPs per event

last_event.description: By the date of the last event happened

gender_other.description: By the proportion of people who identify themselves as gender other than female or male

average_age.description: By the average age of members

next_event.description: By the date of the next event scheduled

GetProGroups.summary: Name and statistics range search for the meetup groups belonging to Pro organization.
GetProGroups.notes: All parameters are optional. `order` and `desc` can take multiple items in a comma-delimited list.

GetProMembers.name: GetProMembers

events_attended_max.description: Positive Integer: Maximum number of attended events

chapters.description: List of Integers: The chapters which the member belongs to

is_organizer.description: By whether the member is an organizer or not

active_within_days.description: Positive Integer: The range of date from the past until today, for the recent activity

join_time_min.description: Milliseconds since epoch: The oldest time limit for member join

email_received.description: Integers: The id of a previous emails that the member received

events_attended_min.description: Positive Integer: Minimum number of attended events

radius.description: String: `global`, `smart`, or search radius in Float

join_time_max.description: Milliseconds since epoch: The latest time limit for member join

join_time.description: By the time when the member joined Meetup

last_access_time.description: By the time of most recent visit

events_attended.description: By the number of events attended

GetProMembers.summary: Name, location, and time based search for the members of the meetups belonging to Pro organization.

GetProTickets.name: GetProTickets

country.description: String: two-letter country code of the redeemed chapters

chapter_name.description: By the name of the chapter that redeemed the ticket

ticket_key.description: String: full matching string of an issued ticket key

chapters.description: Comma delimited positive integers: ids of redeemed chapters

status.description: By the redeemed status of the ticket

updated.description: By the update timestamp of ticket

created.description: By the creation timestamp of ticket

GetProTickets.summary: Redeemed chapter, redeemed member, status, and timestamp for tickets belonging to Pro organization.

GetRecommendedGroupTopics.name: GetRecommendedGroupTopics

lang.description: Defines a language preference for ordering results. Valid values are en-USen-AUde-DEeses-ESfr-FRit-ITpt-BRja-JPen-aude-dept-bren-uses-esit-itfr-frja-jpendefritptja. You may also substitute this with the Accept-Language header

other_topics.description: A comma-delimited list of topic ids to inform recommendations

exclude_topics.description: A comma-delimited list of topic ids to exclude from the recommendations

GetRecommendedGroupTopics.summary: Recommends suggestions for group topics based on a text search or other topics

GetRecommendedGroups.name: GetRecommendedGroups

zip.description: Zip code you are searching for recommendations in

country.description: A valid two character country code, defaults to US

instant_join_only.description: Recommend only groups without join requirements and that can be joined instantly

topic_id.description: Comma delimited list of up to 100 topic ids to help inform recommendations

radius.description: Radius in miles. May be 0.0-100.0, 'global' or 'smart', a dynamic radius based on the number of active groups in the area. Defaults to member's preferred radius

fields.description: Request that additional fields (separated by commas) be included in the output.

category.description: A valid category id which limits recommended groups to a particular category

GetRecommendedGroups.summary: Returns groups Meetup finds relevant to you
GetRecommendedGroups.notes: All parameters are optional. You may change the 'location' and 'radius' for the request. If you do not supply a location your request will be based on your IP's geographic location. If the server is unable to produce recommendations in a suitable amount of time, a 503 error will be returned.

GetRecommendedVenues.name: GetRecommendedVenues

zip.description: Zip code you are searching for recommendations in

country.description: A valid two character country code, defaults to US

used_between.description: Return venues that have been used within the given time range, defined by two times separated with a single comma. Each end of the range may be specified with relative dates, such as "1m" for one month from now, or by absolute time in milliseconds since the epoch. If an endpoint is omitted, the range is unbounded on that end. The default value is unbounded on both ends (though restricted to the search window described above).

min_groups.description: The minimum number of groups that have hosted events at this venue

group_id.description: Comma-delimited list of up to 200 group ids to help inform recommendations

radius.description: Radius in miles. Defaults to member's preferred radius

category.description: Comma-delimited list of up to 200 category ids to help inform recommendations

group_urlname.description: Comma-delimited list of up to 200 group urlnames to help inform recommendations

GetRecommendedVenues.summary: Returns venues Meetup finds relevant to you based on location and category. This method does not yet support sorting or pagination.
GetRecommendedVenues.notes: All parameters are optional. If you do not supply a location your request will be based on your IP's geographic location. If the server is unable to produce recommendations in a suitable amount of time, a 503 error will be returned.

GetSelfBlocks.name: GetSelfBlocks
GetSelfBlocks.summary: Checks the block status for a target member relative to the authenticated member
GetSelfBlocks.notes: A valid member_id path parameter for the target member is required.

GetSelfCalendar.name: GetSelfCalendar

fields.description: A comma-delimited list of optional fields names which may be appended to the response

GetSelfCalendar.summary: Get a listing of all upcoming Meetup events for the authenticated member
GetSelfCalendar.notes:
All parameters are optional.

This endpoint uses HTTP [Link header based pagination](/meetup_api/docs/#v3_json)

GetSelfEvents.name: GetSelfEvents

scroll.description:
A string representing a scroll target.

Supported values are as follows.

__recent_past__: Scroll to the last RSVP'd Meetup Event that has passed.
 If there is no recent RSVP, this defaults to __next_upcoming__

__next_upcoming__: Scroll to the next upcoming Meetup Event the authenticated member
RSVP'd to.

Alternatively the server may generate a scroll value used for pagination Link headers.
Clients should treat the contents of those as a transparent string. Its
contents are subject to change in the future

fields.description: A comma-delimited list of optional fields names which may be appended to the response

GetSelfEvents.summary:
Gets a listing of all Meetup Events the authenticated member has RSVP'd for
and have both a date and time that have been announced to the group.
This listing is ordered from oldest to most recent
GetSelfEvents.notes:
This endpoint uses HTTP [Link header based pagination](/meetup_api/docs/#v3_json). Clients may
use the scroll request parameter to jump to a target scroll location.
Valid values for scroll targets are defined below.
A 'page' parameter may be provided to control the number of results returned.

GetSelfGroups.name: GetSelfGroups

fields.description: A comma-delimited list of optional fields to append to the response

GetSelfGroups.summary:
Lists the authenticated member's groups in the order of leadership,
next upcoming event, then alphabetical order by name
GetSelfGroups.notes: This endpoint uses HTTP [Link header based pagination](/meetup_api/docs/#v3_json).

GetStatus.name: GetStatus
GetStatus.summary: Returns the current API service status
